It is a neutral-cool light color palette of taupes and a light terracotta that pairs very well with the strong lip color in the collection.   It gives a sculpted look that is quite natural looking and would be appropriate for work, and casual daily wear.   The colors give a perfect subtle backdrop to black liquid liner and false lashes (how I like to wear it).  That look is identical to Gwen on the website.     This shadow palette won't steal the show from a dramatic lip, which can be a good thing.    I found the shadows a bit powdery- you have to apply carefully or use your fingers- but it was not the worst I'd seen (hello ABH).   The color payoff was decent.  You have to remember these are lighter colors and will not give a dramatic look- no matter how much you apply.   I found they were velvety and blended quite well on the eye.  The shadows wore extremely well over primer.   They even survived a two-hour workout.     The packaging could stand improvement- the case is plastic-y and hard to open- and is more in line with drug store quality.   Do I think it is a must-have?  No.  I think most of us have similar shadows in our stash already.   But I am pleased enough with how the palette looks with Gwen's new lipcolor (which is fantastic) to keep it.

reviews.review_title: Small amount of product. Powdery. Cheap packaging.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Colors are great, neutral and matte. Very powdery - I think that’s preference (I personally don’t love it). The size of the product is small. You don’t get a ton of product so it is a bit overpriced for what you get. The packaging is also feels cheap.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, red hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The colors of the rose gold palette are beautiful and apply to the eyelids very nicely. So far this eyeshadow lasts all day for me and doesn't smudge easily.

reviews.review_shade_purchased: Simple Kind Of Life - matte neutral
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is more of a sculpting palette for neutral skin tones.  The formula is powdery. The lighter colors don't show up on my fair skin. The darkest color shows up best,  but when I put it over the other colors,  it looks muddy. All the colors blend together and look like one color. It reminds me of morphe consistency without the color party off. You can create a nice look, but you will see the result better with eyeliner and mascara.  Maybe the other palettes will show up better? Not what I was expecting.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I'm not sure why people are hating on this. I'm really enjoying it. If you love cool toned neutral shadows then this one is a great choice.  It's a great day to night palette.  It does have some kick up in the pan but its not falling all over my face.  The only shade I had any fallout with was secrets and it was just the glitter.  That shade is a matte with some gold glitter and any shadow I've ever used that is a matte with glitter the glitter falls out when you blend it. This palette builds and blends easily without being patchy. I recently bought the Charlotte Tilbury super nudes palette and I'm honestly liking this one more.  The CT black shade is just not pigmented enough and comes out patchy.  For $28 this is a nice palette and I'm so glad she kept it reasonable. She easily could have charged twice as much. I'm excited to see more from her!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Extremely cheap. Definitely not as described. Bad color payoff and very powdery. Reminds me of a cheap makeup kit eyeshadow for a little girl to play with. Definitely not worth the $.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: gorgeous mini palette! great color pay off. perfect neutrals. I'm so in love.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, auburn hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Not a fan - I loved the Gwen Urban Decay pallet so I was hoping some of the shades would be similar. Not sure if I got a bad batch but the colors do not look the same in person as they do on the website. More grey then brown and look muddy when applied.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Its really pretty.  The colours in the palette are similar but in a way that they compliment each other when used together and create a your eyes but better kind of look. Or alone each are soft but definitely making a difference. Its the palette I always wanted trying to create those eye looks where celebrities  just look polished.  I dont always need a palette where there's 10 different shades from one scale to the next; this is actually very refreshing to my collection.  It is powdery but not in an extreme way, I think a lighter touch is helpful and the formula blends really beautifully. My only real complaint is the packaging though cool is on the cheap side, but, thats a nit pick. It's not revolutionary but not everything has to be.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Ordered 2 of these right way because I LOVE Gwen Stefani. I received them today. I couldn’t believe how disappointed I was with these. No color payoff, extremely powdery not even close to creamy like describes. I so wish Gwen had done a better job with these eyeshadows. I did also buy a liner in which I tested out quickly  before taking my shower tonight and they seem amazing. Went on beautiful. Didn’t get a chance to wear test them though.

reviews.review_buyer_description: blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love this palette. All the quality and coolness I expect from Gwen! I also tried my friend's Simple Kind of Life palette and loved that one as well. My next order will include that one. So happy to have a Gwen makeup brand. Very nice stuff.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, red hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: As a big fan of Gwen stefani … I had to get my hands on her new makeup line ! I so glad I chose this palette to create the best Smokey neutral eye

reviews.review_shade_purchased: Simple Kind Of Life - matte neutral
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, gray hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Right off the bat, these don't look ANYTHING like the picture. Very muted. the pink isn't pink, the mauve-grey is brown. Maybe I got a bad batch?? I guess I'll have to go into a store and look but as of now I'm sending this back. It's just 3 taupes and a terra cotta. Very disappointed. No wonder none of the online marketing is showing the eye shadow palettes.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Simple Kind of Life is the quad palette I’ve wanted someone to make for so long: four solid office-wearable mattes (my hooded, middle-age eyes are so over the shimmer palettes with the token matte terracotta shade). It is a bit powdery in the pan, but I don’t have any issues with fallout around the eyes. The compact is darn difficult to snap open though.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I love it and I Highly recommend. its well worth the price!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Love the colors included in this palette. So soft and beautiful for everyday wear. The difficult part is how very powdery the formulation is. Fallout everywhere.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Highly disappointed with this pallete. On the upside it is a true cool pallet but the rest of the promises fall short. There is a great deal of product kickup which reminds me of the ABH Subculture pallete fail. The shadow is soft but has no color payout even over the Urban Decay eye primer.  Although I didn’t expect these shadows to be perfect I did expect them to be more than subpar.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This isn’t worth the price not much pigment very powdery the simple kind of life quod  is even worst I don’t recommend it .

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The quality is not much it compared to a cover girl or revlon type of shadow for $28 I’m disappointed  there’s no pigment im very light fair skin tone you better off with Natasha Denona her shadow quality is amazing and is even cheaper elf but size eye shadow is even better than Gwen eye shadow !

reviews.review_shade_purchased: Simple Kind Of Life - matte neutral
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I bought this on a whim, mostly nostalgic over her UD collab years ago. The shades are nice enough, a little powdery but a good neutral option. I wouldn’t call this a “must buy” if you’re looking to start a neutrals collection - there are other palettes out there that have way more to offer. I like having it in my collection but think some of the other quad shades she released may ‘wow’ more.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This palette is just right for anyone that leans towards a good matte. Three colors are matte and one shimmer. They are creamy feeling for a powder and I think have a good pigment. I feel the price point is good for a palette this size.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, red hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Ok I absolutely love this! Very blendable and easy to work with shadows. Such a perfect little quad for an every day look but easy to amp up the drama with the black shade! Also the packaging is probably my fave packaging of all time. Total win for me!

reviews.review_shade_purchased: Simple Kind Of Life - matte neutral
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Not enough product. I would have paid some more to get a decent amount of product. Really disappointed. Also the colors look different in person overall a big let down.

reviews.review_shade_purchased: Simple Kind Of Life - matte neutral
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I am surprised that I LOVE this… even tho it’s matte, it’s gotta Smokey matte aspect to it..:. And I am surprised at just how much I love it
